H0.text: Diameter is increased in the blood vessels of the skin when the brain senses that body temperature is rising.

H1.text: Surface is increased by the brainâ€™s messages to the blood vessels in the skin when it senses that body temperature is rising.

H2.text: Height is increased in the blood vessels in the skin when the brain senses that body temperature is increasing.

H3.text: Weight is increased in the blood vessels in the skin when the brain senses that body temperature is increasing.

A4.text: Vasodilation occurs in superficial blood vessels of warm-blooded animals when their ambient environment is hot; this process diverts the flow of heated blood to the skin of the animal, where heat can be more easily released to the environment.
